show.title: The Wake Up Call

title: The Origins Of Happiness
content:
Does economic progress automatically increase happiness? <!--more--> There are ugly studies which show that current levels of happiness are far below those of bygone eras.
But no definitive studies have been made in this regard.
Material comforts seem to lead to social disintegration and spiritual emptiness.
Who can pinpoint the era which enjoyed the highest level of happiness?
Increased populations do not necessarily encourage closer friendships: they often lead to increased loneliness.
Evolution has no interest in happiness.
It is only interested in survival and reproduction.
Recreational drugs are a kind of pathetic way to find happiness.
How well do they work?
Â  Dentists seem to have the answer to where the economy is headed.
Listen to Jim Rickards talking about deflation and the depression.
A look at where the economy would be if unnecessary regulations were removed and by how much GDP would consequently increase.
The figures are quite sobering.
